intro: Calyptranthes ubatubana, commonly known as the Ubatuba calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related species. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
